strings.Value: "Time to explain yourself, Enneo."
[Attack] "You've grown tiresome. Defend yourself!"
"So, you deliberately sent the elves to their deaths? They weren't undead. What grudge did you hold with them?"
"Why did you kill Taneka's daughters?"
"That's all well and good. But why do you come here now?"
[Attack] "I've heard enough, and now it's your turn to feel the blade!"
[Side with Enneo] "It was a mistake for me to ally with an undead murderer. I now know that Jaethal will never stop, and I must support you, Enneo."
[Side with Jaethal] "Jaethal has served me well. I cannot allow you to kill her."
[Side with Jaethal] "I care nothing for such nonsense as the blood of the innocent. But I can control Jaethal, and that's more than I can say for you. Which is unfortunate for you."
[Side with Enneo] "Allegiance with an undead follower of a dangerous cult — this is harmful to my reputation. That's my only reason for supporting you, Enneo."
[Side with Jaethal] "You are a dangerous fanatic! Innocent people have died because of you. More blood may be spilled unless you are stopped."
"Did you track down Jaethal right after her expulsion from Kyonin?"

{n}The false merchant {d|Enneo}Enneo{/d} walks towards you with an easy gait. His calm friendliness has disappeared, like a mask fallen from his face. His clothes are decorated with the easily-distinguishable symbol of {g|Pharasma}Pharasma{/g}.{/n} "I hope you've settled all your affairs with the poor old exile? It was an interesting show to watch."

"I don't have much to add, beyond what I'm sure you already know. I'm the inquisitor of {g|Pharasma}Pharasma{/g}, and for almost forty years I've hunted the undead and cultists of {g|Urgathoa}Urgathoa{/g}, for the glory of the Lady of Graves. I destroyed Taneka's coven. I tracked Jaethal into the wasteland and killed her — only to find that her hideous deity returned her to 'life'. To put an end to that, I made use of a company of naive young elves from a camp near the {g|Thorn River}Thorn River{/g}."
{n}The undead priestess tightens like a predator preparing to strike.{/n} "You... so many years later, and you come to me again. Why are you here? Why stand once more between me and immortality?"
"What a stunning frankness." {n}Jaethal smiles lightly, almost affectionately.{/n} "Did you imagine, half-blood, that those youngsters could handle me and the {mf|baron|baroness|king|queen}?

"Do not be so naive, inquisitor. I held no hope that the young elves would kill either you or your defender. No, I wanted you, rather, to kill them. And I did all I could to inform their relatives in {g|Kyonin}Kyonin{/g} of the horrible violence you perpetrated. Retribution will follow, sooner or later. One lonely warrior of {g|Pharasma}Pharasma{/g} may fail, but three elven clans will find a way to exact their revenge. There's no way out, Jaethal. Not for you."

"They were a necessary tool to complete my mission. In my youth, I thought the best decision was a bold, honest battle against apostates and monsters. But I learned much from my struggle against Taneka. There's nothing worse than seeing an abomination rise before you, and being powerless to strike it down. One must use any method available."

"They were necessary for her disgusting ritual, and their death was my only chance to prevent it. Do not forget who I serve. Their honest deaths, and their souls' journey to {g|Pharasma}Pharasma's{/g} judgment, was a far better fate than their mother had prepared for them."

"I wanted to talk to you, {mf|baron|baroness|king|queen}. My hunt for Jaethal is the greatest work of my life. She is the living example of the hideous essence of the cult of {g|Urgathoa}Urgathoa{/g}, the distortion of the world order, and the triumph of the evil intentions of her vile deity. Even if I die today, this story will end the way I intended. But you can still change your own role in it, {name}."
"You've been playing games for too long, zealot."

{n}Enneo allows himself to smile for the first time. {/n} "I've heard this so many times, even among the priests of {g|Pharasma}Pharasma{/g}. There are many who think my faith is insane, and my methods cruel and excessive. But that is the fate of the inquisitor. Loneliness."
"No. No! I cannot die, I will not die!"
"I was so eager to attain un-life, and now to lose it so quickly..."
"Everything will proceed as I have planned, with or without me."
"Well, I shall risk immortality for your death, Pharasmite."

"Immediately after the trial. I was born in {g|Kyonin}Kyonin{/g} and often visited. It is uncommon for high-society ladies to perform ritual murders for the glory of the dark goddess, so the news quickly reached my native {g|Greengold}Greengold{/g}, and soon came to me. When later, the elves sentenced her to exile, rather than the usual life imprisonment — well, how could I stay away?"
"Nothing can justify the blood on your hands and the stain on your conscience! The law is strict, but it should not take innocent lives to punish the guilty."
"Sharp lad! I like you."
"The dead one's scum, of course, but at least she's our scum. And she always helps in fights. But I don't like this other guy at all! He lied to us, told us tales. So let him beat it!"
"Jaethal's been dead for a long time. A dead heart, and a dead soul. Let {g|Pharasma}Pharasma{/g}'s inquisitor commit his judgment — the world will sigh with relief."
"First goddess. Second goddess. Nope, not gonna mess with them. But I know for sure: my goddess is better."
"What use is a dead horse in a harness? Let's be rid of her. First she lost her position and respect, then she lost her life. Who needs a servant like her?"
